organizations: Major League Gaming in New Orleans

thread.title: Final competition brings together gamers from around the world to Crescent City
thread.title_full: Final competition brings together gamers from around the world to Crescent City

title: Final competition brings together gamers from around the world to Crescent City
text:
Final competition brings together gamers from around the world to Crescent City Published 12:51 PM CDT Oct 18, 2015 Photos: Major League Gaming in New Orleans 1 of 10 Previous Next 
Three days of intense competition will come to an end Sunday in New Orleans. But the event isn't your typical outdoors or face-to-face rivalry. Related Bicycling enthusiasts gather for... 
Major League Gaming brings together over 50,000 live-event competitors for the change to win over $500,000 by playing "Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare" and "Dota 2." 
Organizers announced the event would take place in New Orleans earlier this year. MLG is professional-level video game playing with 9 million registered users across the world. Tournaments have been broadcast on television and ESPN.com. 
"New Orleans continues to host some of the world’s best events and this will be another unbelievable experience for New Orleans residents and visitors alike,” said Mayor Mitch Landrieu in June. “With a booming entrepreneurial community, great sports traditions and a vibrant, diverse culture, New Orleans is the perfect city for world-class sports and gaming entertainment.” 
LINK: Details about MLG Finals in New Orleans 
Competitors can be sponsored or endorsed by big brands like soda companies, computer technology computers and others. It's an event that welcomes all those who devote much of their time and energy to the virtual world of video gaming. 
“For the better part of a decade we’ve been hosting incredible tournaments and given out an insane amount of prize money, and we wanted to honor that tradition with our 100th event by making it bigger and better than ever before,” said Mike Sepso, president and cofounder of MLG. 
The event has been taking place at the Ernest N. Morial Convention Center. The championship event will be held Sunday. More information on the event can be found online .
